baseline_texts: The image shows a person's hand holding several playing cards. The background includes a blue wall on the left side and a blue surface or table on the right side. The scene appears to be indoors, and the focus is primarily on the hand and the cards, which are held in a fanned-out manner. The setting is simple with minimal objects visible.

The frame shows a close-up of a hand holding what appears to be a deck of cards or a stack of thin rectangular objects. The background features a blue wall and a blue table or surface. The lighting is moderate, and the setting looks simple and unadorned. The viewpoint suggests the person holding the cards is about to shuffle or deal them.

The image shows a close-up view of a blue surface, likely a table or a desk. On this surface, there is a small rectangular object, possibly a piece of eraser or a small block. The background features a blue wall and a dark doorway or dark area to the right. The lighting is somewhat dim, giving the scene a slightly shadowed appearance. The photo is slightly out of focus.

The image shows a simple indoor scene with a blue table positioned against a blue wall. On the table, there is a closed book with the title "Explore" visible on the cover. The room appears to have a somewhat plain, unadorned appearance, with a door or doorway partially visible on the right side of the image, next to a black curtain or dark area. The lighting is moderately dim, creating some shadows on the wall and table.

The image shows a close-up of a corner of a room with blue walls and a blue surface, possibly a table or a bench. On the blue surface, there is a single book placed near the corner. The book has a dark cover with some text on it, but the text is upside down and not fully readable. The background also includes a dark curtain or fabric hanging on the right side. The overall scene appears simple and minimalistic.
diff_texts: Initial frame. No previous frame to compare.
The hand holding the object has moved slightly downward and the object has tilted backward.
The main object, a book, moved from being held in a hand to lying flat on a table. The hand that was holding the book is no longer visible in the current frame.
The main object, a book, has moved closer to the edge of the blue table and is now more clearly visible and aligned with the front edge of the table compared to the previous frame.
The book on the table has been rotated slightly counterclockwise.
